meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or using logarithms.
meanings.sent1: The student struggled with the logarithmic calculations in math class.
meanings.sent2: The logarithmic scale helped scientists analyze the data more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The logarithmic growth of the plant surprised everyone in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the topic was logarithmic, growing exponentially with each lesson.
meanings.sent5: The logarithmic nature of the problem made it both challenging and fascinating to solve.

meanings.definition: Increasing in proportion to the logarithm of a variable.
meanings.sent1: The speed of the car was logarithmic to the distance traveled.
meanings.sent2: As the temperature dropped, the logarithmic decrease in energy consumption was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The logarithmic relationship between effort and reward made the task more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement grew logarithmically as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the decision was logarithmic, affecting every aspect of her life.
